page.title: 02THE RIVER TONE
page.content: The river Tone runs through six of our twelve KM squares. It starts up in the Brendon hills where lots of little streams, called tributies, run together. Then it comes down through Wellisford and Thorne St Margret and then through Runnington and Wellington. Here the river is wider and deeper and beside it runs the remains of the Great Western canal. Eventually it joins the river Parrat which runs through Bridgewater and out at Bridgewater bay. There are trees growing along side the river which are mainly Alder. The river is the habitat for many different birds.This part of the river isn't yet polluted and people often fish along its banks but only for minnoes,trout and possibly eels.
